name: dzBuchstabier
short_description:
Have you ever had to spell something over the phone? Did you remember the phonetic alphabet in that case? Or was it just kind of embarrassing like "f as in f***, oh, emm, flight"? Buchstabier is a small utility that allows you to type a word and to select one of the following phonetic alphabets to use for spelling:
* Deutschland (German)
* Österreich (Austrian)
* Schweiz (Swiss)
* NATO
* Joint Army/Navy
The program was written as an exercise in four different languages/IDEs: C#-Builder, C++Builder, Delphi and Delphi.NET using Borland Rad Studio 2005. Since then C#' and Delphi.NET have been discontinued and I have only included the Delphi source code. But I still think it is useful.
summary: Tool for spelling in different phonetic alphabets
